comments.body: Why is it field `11` and not `10`?

This was automatically updated with `make update`. Going through the file there is already a number `10`:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/6115f15de19307871ff09ee950939f426b6ab56d/staging/src/k8s.io/api/core/v1/generated.proto#L4488
Why is it desirable to allow them to be different? Why not either set them to match or clear the nominatedNodeName once nodeName is set?

There are a couple of reasons:
1. It is useful to understand/debug behavior of the cluster. When a pod causes preemption, but it is scheduled elsewhere, checking nominatedNodeName reveals that this is the pod that caused  preemption on the node. Users who don't have access to scheduler logs can still see this field.
2. Performance: setting the nominatedNodeName to match the nodeName or clearing it requires another API call.

Note that this change is safe only because LocalObjectReference and SecretReference have the same tag 1 (name) and SecretReference has a second tag 2 (namespace).  If that was not the case, this change would be unsafe.

@kubernetes/api-approvers please remember to check that when API changes alter the type of a struct that the underlying object has the same proto tags.  Otherwise these changes would not be allowed and we'd have to introduce a new JSON field that overrides the old one.
agree. in this case, that was intentionally done so the PV references would have a safe struct to switch to for qualified references.
